name: The Panorama Hotel On the Bund Shanghai

reviews.title: Good hotel
reviews.text: I got a great rate on the two bedroom suite and stayed there with my father and girlfriend. The suite was on the 17:th floor and had two bedrooms, workroom, livingroom, two bathrooms (one with shower, one with jacuzzi) and kitchen (though NO kitchen utensils, not even a spoon). The suite was a bit worn but nothing disturbing. The floor and furniture was dark wood. What I missed was paintings or something else on the wall, the suite felt unfinished. There were some english channels on the tv, but the view over the river was much better.

reviews.title: Great value for groups or leisure travellers
reviews.text: Reception desk seemed to be manned with one who could speak english at all times. Breakfast was both chinese & western and ok.

reviews.title: This Hotel could be great but is terrible
reviews.text: After a small excursion, my girlfriend and I returned to the hotel, this time staying in the cheapest room. The room had the same floor, and was of quite alright size. However it was more worn with paint coming off at places. The view was the thing we missed the most in this room. The windows were really dirty and faced the skyscraper next door.
I took a group of 30 people to this hotel in March 2006. It was a bit of a gamble since I had never stayed here before. Happy to report that I would do it again.
reviews.title: "Shabby-chic" at the Panorama
Loved the Panaroma Century Court Hotel
reviews.text: I had a two room suite with a view, and what a view it was (best to ask for floor 15 or higher). From my double bed I had a floor to ceiling view of the Huangpu River and the Pudong area - especially brilliant when lit at night.

reviews.title: Terrific view ...
reviews.text: Dec 25-27: Fantastic view of the HuangPu River, the Pearl Tower, the Bund from the hotel room on the 25th floor. Great lights at night scenes.
